definition: to suppress/to muzzle/to gag
pincers/pliers/tongs/claw (of animal)/to grasp with pincers/to pinch/to clamp/to restrain/to restrict/to gag
to manufacture/to make
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: The government tried to muzzle freedom of speech.
sentences.chinese: 政府试图钳制言论自由。

sentences.english: And art made tongue-tied by authority.
sentences.chinese: 学术结舌失语，饱受当局钳制。

sentences.english: But critics contend it just as easily muzzles the press.
sentences.chinese: 但批评家认为这反而为钳制媒体创造了便利。

sentences.english: Methods The whole-cell patch clamp with current clamp was used.
sentences.chinese: 方法采用全细胞膜片钳技术，进行电流钳制。
政府钳制报纸的言论自由。
